Key Match Events: Sri Lanka chased down the target of 184 in 19.2 Overs for the loss of eight wickets
Bangladesh lost both their group matches
Sri Lanka qualified for the Super Four stage
Pre-Game Insights: Both Sri Lanka and Bangladesh have been humbled by a red-hot Afghanistan in their respective opening matches of the ongoing Asia Cup 2022
Both teams need to win to ensure a passage to the next stage
India and Afghanistan have already qualified for the next round
Sri Lanka have won the tournament five times before while Bangladesh finished runners-up in 2018
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka have become the third team to qualify for the Super Four, joining India and Afghanistan in the next round
Bangladesh exited the tournament after losing both their group matches
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dasun Shanaka won the coin toss and opted to bowl first
Sri Lanka made one change to their playing XI with Matheesha Pathirana benched and replaced by Asitha Fernando
Bangladesh made three changes with Mohammad Naim, Anamul Haque and Mohammad Saifuddin dropped, and Sabbir Rahman, Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Ebadot Hossain replacing them
